description: With the start of the Major League Baseball season postponed due to the coronavirus pandemic, we here at The Denver Post took a look at how the Rockies would fare in MLB The Show 20 on PlayStation 4. SAN FRANCISCO- The Rockies crushed four home runs, including two by shortstop Trevor Story, en route to a 8-2 victory Sunday over the Giants for a series sweep in Oracle...
text:
With the start of the Major League Baseball season postponed due to the
coronavirus pandemic, we here at The Denver Post took a look at how the
Rockies would fare in MLB The Show 20 on PlayStation 4. We will have a story
for every game that had been scheduled until real-life baseball returns.
Here's a look at the virtual Rockies' preseason preview. Entering Sunday's
game, the Rockies were 37-20.

SAN FRANCISCO \- The Rockies crushed four home runs, including two by
shortstop Trevor Story, en route to a 8-2 victory Sunday over the Giants for a
series sweep in Oracle Park.

Colorado got on the board in the first inning off of back-to-back solo shots
by third baseman Nolan Arenado and Story. The Rockies shortstop added two more
on a two-run blast in the third inning that drove in Arenado. Outfielder Ian
Desmond had his own two-run homer in the fifth, driving in Garrett Hampson to
make it 6-0.

Senzatela (5-0) kept his record perfect, allowing one run on five hits in five
innings of work. His counterpart, Giants starter Drew Smyly (1-7), had a tough
outing, giving up six runs on eight hits in 4 2/3 innings.

Colorado improves to 38-20, maintains a three-game lead over the Dodgers
(35-23) in the National League West. The Giants fall to 26-33 into a tie for
the bottom of the division with Arizona.

Kyle Freeland (5-4) takes the mound for the Rockies Monday against
Diamondbacks starter Alex Young (3-7). The live stream will begin at 11 a.m.
MT.

Box score

COL - 202-020-002 - 8-10-0

SFG - 010-000-100 - 2-8-1

Colorado \- Dahl 5-1-1-0, Blackmon 5-0-0-0, Arenado 5-2-2-1, Story 4-3-2-3,
McMahon 4-0-2-0, Hampson 5-1-2-2, Desmond 4-1-1-2, Wolters 3-0-0-0, Senzatela
1-0-0-0, Estevez 0-0-0-0, Tapia 1-0-0-0, Shaw 0-0-0-0. Totals - 37-8-10-8.

San Francisco \- Duggar 4-0-1-0, Crawford 4-0-0-0, Flores 4-0-3-0, Yastrzemski
4-1-2-0, Pence 3-0-0-0, Belt 4-0-0-0, Longoria 4-1-2-1, Garcia 3-0-0-0, Smyly
1-0-0-0, Webb 1-0-0-0, Anderson 0-0-0-0, Solano 1-0-0-1, Gustave 0-0-0-0,
Watson 0-0-0-0. Totals - 33-2-8-2.

E - Crawford. 2B - McMahon 2, Hampson; Yastrzemski, Longoria, Flores. HR -
Story 2, Arenado, Desmond. WP - Senzatela (5-0). LP - Smyly (1-7).

Mobile users, if you can't see the video, tap here.

title: Trevor Story hits 2 homers as Rockies sweep Giants in MLB The Show 20
html:
With the start of the Major League Baseball season postponed due to the coronavirus pandemic, we here at The Denver Post took a look at how the Rockies would fare in MLB The Show 20 on PlayStation 4. We will have a story for every game that had been scheduled until real-life baseball returns. Here's a look at the virtual Rockies' preseason preview. Entering Sunday's game, the Rockies were 37-20.

SAN FRANCISCO - The Rockies crushed four home runs, including two by shortstop Trevor Story, en route to a 8-2 victory Sunday over the Giants for a series sweep in Oracle Park.

Colorado got on the board in the first inning off of back-to-back solo shots by third baseman Nolan Arenado and Story. The Rockies shortstop added two more on a two-run blast in the third inning that drove in Arenado. Outfielder Ian Desmond had his own two-run homer in the fifth, driving in Garrett Hampson to make it 6-0.

Senzatela (5-0) kept his record perfect, allowing one run on five hits in five innings of work. His counterpart, Giants starter Drew Smyly (1-7), had a tough outing, giving up six runs on eight hits in 4 2/3 innings.

Colorado improves to 38-20, maintains a three-game lead over the Dodgers (35-23) in the National League West. The Giants fall to 26-33 into a tie for the bottom of the division with Arizona.

Kyle Freeland (5-4) takes the mound for the Rockies Monday against Diamondbacks starter Alex Young (3-7). The live stream will begin at 11 a.m. MT.

Box score

COL - 202-020-002 - 8-10-0

SFG - 010-000-100 - 2-8-1

Colorado - Dahl 5-1-1-0, Blackmon 5-0-0-0, Arenado 5-2-2-1, Story 4-3-2-3, McMahon 4-0-2-0, Hampson 5-1-2-2, Desmond 4-1-1-2, Wolters 3-0-0-0, Senzatela 1-0-0-0, Estevez 0-0-0-0, Tapia 1-0-0-0, Shaw 0-0-0-0. Totals - 37-8-10-8.

San Francisco - Duggar 4-0-1-0, Crawford 4-0-0-0, Flores 4-0-3-0, Yastrzemski 4-1-2-0, Pence 3-0-0-0, Belt 4-0-0-0, Longoria 4-1-2-1, Garcia 3-0-0-0, Smyly 1-0-0-0, Webb 1-0-0-0, Anderson 0-0-0-0, Solano 1-0-0-1, Gustave 0-0-0-0, Watson 0-0-0-0. Totals - 33-2-8-2.

E - Crawford. 2B - McMahon 2, Hampson; Yastrzemski, Longoria, Flores. HR - Story 2, Arenado, Desmond. WP - Senzatela (5-0). LP - Smyly (1-7).
